laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Reportedly had been 1.4 mg/dL the previous year; increased to 2.7 mg/dL at this time
Decreased to 24.7% on admission, later 28.1% and then 27.2% on subsequent days
Decreased to 8.6 g/dL on admission, later increased to 12.1 g/dL and then 9.5 g/dL
Decreased to 4400 on admission, later increased to 12,100 and then 11,700
Rose daily during hospitalization; was 2.8 mg/dL on 3rd hospital day and 3.8 mg/dL on 2nd hospital day
Increased from 37 mg/dL (5 days before admission) to 58 mg/dL (3rd hospital day) to 102 mg/dL (hospital day of admission)

laboratory_examinations.findings: Occult blood: 4+ at 5 days before admission, 3+ on admission; Albumin: 3+ on both occasions; Red cells too numerous to count at 5 days before admission, >100 on admission
Initially negative, later detected using Western blot analysis

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Declined from 23 ml/min/1.73 m² (5 days prior) to 16 ml/min/1.73 m² (3rd hospital day)
